comments:
I am not 100% sure how to reproduce this, but I sometimes get the exception below when I try to delete a file (or a directory?) from Package Explorer. After this exception, I see "Confirm delete" pop with all buttons greyed out and I have to kill/restart Eclipse in order to contunue.

Mylar 0.4.3, Eclipse 3.1.1 + WTP.

I'll try to add "if resource.exists()" to MylarChangeSetManager.interestChanged to see if they problem will reappear.

!MESSAGE Resource /com.ibm.tivoli.tpm.metadata.test/resources/test/audit/oracle/E004DAO.java does not exist.

I had this pop up too.  Fixed, as you suggest, by checking that non-existing resources aren't added or deleted from the set:

   if (resource != null && resource.exists())
